name: Depression in adults: preventing relapse
citation: NICE guideline on depression in adults: treatment and management
rules: IF a person has completed treatment for depression THEN assess if full or partial remission has been achieved.
IF full or partial remission has NOT been achieved THEN follow further line treatment recommendations.
IF full or partial remission has been achieved THEN assess if the person is at higher risk of relapse.
IF the person is at higher risk of relapse THEN consider continuing treatment with modifications for relapse prevention.
IF the person is NOT at higher risk of relapse THEN discuss pros and cons of continued treatment.
IF psychological therapy alone achieved remission THEN consider continuing with adapted therapy for relapse prevention.
IF antidepressants alone achieved remission THEN consider continuing with the same dose or switch to alternatives if discontinuing.
IF combination treatment achieved remission THEN consider continuing both or choose one based on guidelines.
IF choosing to discontinue medication THEN explain withdrawal process and emphasize seeking help if symptoms recur.
Review antidepressant medication at least every 6 months, and psychological interventions when finishing relapse prevention treatment.

nodes.text: Has the person completed treatment for depression?
Has full or partial remission been achieved following acute treatment?
Is the person at higher risk of relapse?
Continue treatment with modifications for relapse prevention.
Discuss pros and cons of continued treatment.
Continue with adapted psychological therapy for relapse prevention.
Continue with the same antidepressant dose.
Switch to group CBT or MBCT if discontinuing antidepressants.
Continue combination treatment or choose one component based on guidelines.
Explain safe withdrawal from medication and symptoms monitoring.
Review medication at least every 6 months or as per treatment completion.
